item.title: Report X-2024051111
item.description:
Report X-2024051111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 105 WEARING PROPER PPE, USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024050784
item.description:
Report X-2024050784

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. ON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW ONE PACKAGE WITH A SMALL STAIN ON THE CORNER. UPON FUTHER INSPECTION, FOUND THAT THE BOTTLES WERE SHIPPED WITH VENTED CAPS INSIDE OF PLASTIC BAGS. THE VENTED CAPS CAUSED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT DAMAGING THE BOX
